conclusion: Analyze energy and momentum conservation during the collision
Determine pre-collision velocity v1 using conservation of energy: v1 = sqrt(2gH)
Determine post-collision velocity v2 using conservation of energy: v2 = sqrt(2gh)
Air resistance is lambda mg, where 0 < lambda < (H-h)/(H+h)
Calculate work done by air resistance: W_air = lambda mg(H + h)
Change in kinetic energy due to air resistance: Delta K = -lambda mg(H + h)
Relate change in kinetic energy to velocities: Delta K = 1/2 mv1^2 - 1/2 mv2^2
Substitute velocities into kinetic energy equation: 2gH - 2gh = lambda g(H + h)
Solve for velocity ratio: v2/v1 = sqrt(h/H)
Reaffirm the ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity: v2/v1 = sqrt(h/H)
